Photos: James Supercave Live @ Sunset Tavern

By Iggy Pot - September 21, 2017

The LA psych-pop band James Supercave is currently on a co-headlining West Coast tour with The Seshen. Live Eye Tv caught up with the band last night in Seattle at The Sunset Tavern. The group’s 2016 LP Better Strange (Fairfax Recordings) is a rhythmic blend of psycho-activating influences. Groove driven and often laced with candy sweet harmonies, the band’s pop-driven aesthetic never sacrifices the weirdness because everything’s better strange! Performing as a five-piece last night, with vocalist/guitarist Joaquin Pastor‘s infectious presence leading the charge thru a set featuring a heavy dose of Better Strange standouts, the band’s heady pop never lost its’ funky vibe.

James Supercave has only two remaining West Coast dates. Check out the tour schedule after the photos…

James Supercave Live 2017

  • Thu 21 Sep 2017 Doug Fir Lounge Portland, OR, US
  • Sat 23 Sep 2017 Rickshaw Stop San Francisco, CA, US
